moves.2... d5: Taking the center, because of white's loss of time in h3
moves.5. Bb5+ Nc6 6. Bxc6+ bxc6: Strengthening my center, and gaining the bishop pair.
moves.9... Ne4: Again winning a tempo.  Black has the initiative.  I am still not convinced that this is a good move.
moves.10. Qe2 Bd6 11. Nc3 Nxc3 12. bxc3 O-O 13: Keeping the white king in the center.
end of the combination winning the exchange that started with 14...Ba6
moves.21. f3 Bxe4 22. fxe4 Qxg3+ 23. Qf2 Qe5: I decided to keep the queens on because white's king is in the center.
moves.27. Rd1 Rad8 28. Kf2 Rxd2+ 29. Rxd2 cxd2: Two Queens!  Not sure why he didn't resign a while ago... It is simply finishing the now.
